intro: Galenia affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf galenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, fleshy, blue-green leaves. It produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Galenia affinis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
